Michigan Ongoing Health & Safety Training Refresher 2023
Section 1: Administration of Medications

Medication Permission Form

All licensed providers, centers and homes, are required to have completed medication permission forms. License exempt providers are strongly encouraged to also follow this practice.

It is strongly encouraged that providers use the Medication Permission and Instructions Form from LARA or the form included in the Caring for Children Medication Administration Packet. Links to both of these are found in the Support Material section at the end of this chapter.

The information required on this form includes the following components. Please select each of the plus signs to see an expanded discussion on each part of the form.

Must be completed and signed by the parent 

The form must be completed and signed by the parent or guardian. An electronic signature from the child’s parent is acceptable. For all prescription and nonprescription medications the form must be completely filled out by the parent. Non-prescription topical medications like diaper rash cream and sunscreen, only require annual renewals of the form. 

Must include dose, times given per day, and number of days given 

The form must include the dose, time to be given each day, and the number of days to be given.  If the medication is one that is ordered to only be given when needed (such as tylenol for headaches or an Epipen for emergencies) “As needed” may be written in under time of medication.  This is a good time to note that if the timing works out for a medication to be given at home instead of at the child care program that is always preferred. 

Must include a beginning date and end date

A beginning and end date must be included. If the medication is one that will be used as an ongoing or maintenance dose (such as an inhaler or ADHD medication) it is allowable to write “Ongoing” in the end date.  

Separate form required for each medication 

A separate form must be completed for every medication ordered. 

Must include storage and other directions if specified 

If there are any specific directions regarding storage, handling, disposal or other concerns these should be identified on the form. This is also a good place to list any common side effects of this medicine to be aware of. 

Spaces on form to be completed when administered, including date, time, amount, caregiver name and signature  

The form must also include spaces to be completed by the child care provider when the medication is administered.  There must be spaces that identify the date, time and amount given; in addition to spaces for the caregiver to write and sign their name.
